intro: Petrea subserrata, commonly known as the silverleaf pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often found in coastal and sandy soils. It has a woody structure with smooth, grey bark and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Petrea subserrata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
